message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.DL 

This paper deals with the task of learning word embeddings using category information of documents. The paper evaluates the learned word vectors on sentiment analysis and text classification tasks, which are common tasks in the field of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). 

The paper also uses unsupervised representation learning from large unlabeled corpora, which is a common technique in the field of machine learning. This suggests that the paper could also belong to the sub-categories cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper incorporates global topical information, which is related to information retrieval (IR) and topic modeling. Therefore, it could also belong to the sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

Finally, the paper uses deep learning techniques to learn the proposed models, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-category cs.DL (Deep Learning).
